name: Q4OS
install_guide_markdown:
# Q4OS Installation Guide

## About Q4OS
- Based on Debian (stable foundation)
- Offers Trinity desktop (lightweight KDE 3 fork)
- Ideal for old/limited hardware
- Easy-to-use with optional KDE Plasma

## Prerequisites
- 512MB RAM (Trinity) or 1GB (KDE)
- 8GB disk space
- USB drive (2GB+)
- Works great on older systems

## Step 1: Download ISO
Get Trinity (lightweight) or KDE (modern) version

## Step 2: Create Bootable Media
Use Etcher or dd

## Step 3: Boot Live System
Experience Q4OS before installing

## Step 4: Run Installer
Click install-to-disk from desktop

## Step 5: Configure System
Set hostname, timezone, users

install_steps.title: Download Q4OS ISO
install_steps.detail_md: Choose Trinity (1.4GB, very lightweight) or KDE (2.2GB, more features).

install_steps.title: Create Bootable USB
install_steps.detail_md:
Write ISO to USB:
```
sudo dd if=q4os-5.4-trinity-amd64.iso of=/dev/sdX bs=4M
```

install_steps.title: Boot Live System
install_steps.detail_md: Insert USB and reboot. Select USB in boot menu. Explore Trinity or KDE desktop.

install_steps.title: Launch Installer
install_steps.detail_md: Double-click 'Install to disk' icon on desktop.

install_steps.title: Configure Partitions
install_steps.detail_md: Automatic partitioning recommended. Choose disk and click partition.

install_steps.title: Install Q4OS
install_steps.detail_md: Enter hostname, timezone, user details. Click Install to proceed.

install_steps.title: Post-Installation
install_steps.detail_md:
Update system:
```
sudo apt update && sudo apt upgrade
```
